intro: Chelonopsis albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered chelonopsis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its ornamental, showy white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in terminal inflorescences and bloom during the warmer months. Due to its unique appearance, it is cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic value and sometimes used in traditional medicine.
